Text: Praise the LORD. Praise the LORD, O my soul.
Context: The psalmist begins with a call to praise, addressing himself.

Text: I will praise the LORD all my life; I will sing praises to my God while I have my being.
Context: The psalmist commits to lifelong praise of God.

Text: Do not put your trust in princes, in mortal man, who cannot save.
Context: A warning against misplaced trust in human power.

Text: When his spirit departs, he returns to the ground; on that very day his plans come to nothing.
Context: Reflection on the mortality of humans and the futility of their plans without God.

Text: Blessed is he whose help is the God of Jacob, whose hope is in the LORD his God.
Context: A declaration of the happiness found in trusting God.

Text: He is the Maker of heaven and earth, the sea, and everything in them—He remains faithful forever.
Context: Acknowledgment of God’s creation and everlasting faithfulness.

Text: He upholds the cause of the oppressed and gives food to the hungry. The LORD sets prisoners free,
Context: Recognition of God‘s actions on behalf of the needy.

Text: The LORD gives sight to the blind, the LORD lifts up those who are bowed down, the LORD loves the righteous.
Context: Praise for God’s restorative and supportive actions.

Text: The LORD watches over the foreigner and sustains the fatherless and the widow, but He frustrates the ways of the wicked.
Context: Contrasting how God supports the vulnerable and opposes the wicked.

Text: The LORD reigns forever, your God, O Zion, for all generations. Praise the LORD!
Context: A triumphant conclusion affirming God‘s eternal reign and a final call to praise.
